reviews.sentence: Very nice but rooms lacking. I agree with other reviews that the rooms are definitely old and need an update but otherwise the hotel is top notch. The grounds are very nice the pools are a lot of fun. The overall amenities are high quality. The design and décor of the hallways and the rooms to an extent are probably the way they are because folks are coming and going all wet and sandy the hotel is right on the beach but yes some things could definitely use an upgrade like the bathroom. The AC unit was pretty noisy too. Overall our 2night stay was enjoyable and we would definitely stay here again.

Great stay. After checking out of Destin West next door my family checked into Ramada to extend our stay at Fort Walton Beach by 3 days. During our stay we stayed in two different rooms a pool side room and an ocean front room. Both rooms were very clean and comfortable but nothing fancy. The property is in an excellent location within walking distance to the Boardwalk and Okalosa Pier. I do agree with many of the reviews I read that the rooms are in need of some updating as well as the hallways carpeting etc. The beach is excellent less crowded than the Destin beaches. My 5 and 3 year old loved the polside room because we could swim right up to our back door patio area. The downside to this is having other guests sitting on your patio without permission or lots of kids jumping off of it constantly. All of the staff members we came across were very friendly and the Maintenance and Housekeeping staff were hard workers. I do have to comment on the pool activity staff attendants. I am not sure if their title is lifeguard but it did bother me that the employees who sat by the pool in the chair with the umbrella were constantly on their cell phones. Yes it is the job of parents to look after the children in the pool but it looks very unprofessional to see these workers who are supposed to be on the job constantly playing on their phones. Just a tiny complaint but one I do feel should be addressed. I do feel the hotel is priced fairly high but it does have excellent amenities. I would stay here again.
Needs lots of updates to keep up with the areaOur door. Needs lots of updates to keep up with the areaOur door looked like it was broken into several timesBarely closed.

The A C was nt working from the time I got the room. I rented this room as well as my fellow grad 1981 classmates. I was gone from the time I rented the room til 12 am. I noticed it was very warm in the room when I first entered it. I did not think anything of it and ran the A C on high the whole time I was gone to cool it down. When I got back the outside was actually cooler than the inside of the room. I had to find a Security Guard since the maintenance people had gone home already. He had to move me into another room after he tried to get it cool for about 30min. It was very inconvenient and did not make my stay very enjoyable.

Oldie but a godie. The convenience to the pool and the beach and splash pad was wonderful. The room needs updating desperately for the price being charged per room. The bathroom fan did not work well. The mini frig did not work well. The carpet in the room felt old and dirty. Everything else was great. Overall I would stay there again.

Location. This place is away from all the hustle and bustle of downtown Destin which gives it its best rank. The hotel is fast becoming very dated the interior needs a lot of work the bathrooms need updating the appliances need replacing the furniture in the Suites looks like it came from the 1980s. The beach access is the best thing about this hotel. The splash pool area for the kids is nice. The Grotto pool needs updating. The restaurants need longer hours. The staff was very friendly and helpful and every way they could be. This hotel has so much more potential than it is showing at this time.

very pleasant. Overall the staff does a great job. The waterfall in the pool was the highlight. Absolutely wonderful. my only negative and it is not really a big negative is that the rooms need to be updated desperately. Old noisy AC units old carpeting etc. Beds were comfortable though and bathroom was clean and they did have refrigerators. But for what we paid for the rooms per night one would expect something a little more up to date.

Under much needed renovation After I was moved to a better room the bed and linens were very comfortable. The food was good. Staff person David was helpful. This hotel is under a large renovation the front office door is by huge dumpsters. The rooms are in an old building that has not been updated for many years. The first room I was assigned was dirty and overlooked the inner pool area which is all torn up. When I was moved to an ocean view it was okay for one night. The restaurant is a large banquet type room. I was the only customer when I ordered dinner. Overall this is a depressing hotel and should be shut down until renovation is complete. I would never stay there again or recommend it to anyone.
The place needs a remodeling as soon as possible the roof was leaking in several places rooms are ok but this place feels like a hotel from the 80s. The pool was excellent thumbs up for that.
Disappointing. Access to the beach. I had a nonsmoking room and it was clear the neighboring rooms were smoking. Also they were renovating the property woke up to power tools.

The lobby and pool area looked updated and well kept. But I stayed in the tower on the beach and my room was absolutely disgusting. It smelled like mildew and dried Budweiser beer. The bed was wet from condensation and the air conditioner was pumping out rotten air. the refrigerator was old and barely running. I can go on and on about how bad my room was. good thing I only stayed one night.
Great location. If the rooms were updated this would be the perfect place.

Exceptional. The staff were great. Very helpful. The property was beautiful. Very clean and lots of fun things to do on the property. The location was awesome too. Close to the pier the boardwalk and Destin. We were in a newly renovated room and it was gorgeous. Very modern and clean. The beds were comfy and fit our family greatI could tell the property was a work in progress. We were lucky enough to be in a renovated room so we felt like we were staying at a high end resort. We did walk through other floors and you could tell that several floors stop needed some work. This did not bother me as we were given exactly what we booked.
Hotel will be extremely nice when all renovations are done. Was very upset they removed the splash pad for the kids.

BEACH FRONT. it is an older hotel that has been semi renovated. it is ok. The staff and maintenance crew were awesome. We were polside on the motel part. The pools were great and lots of entertainment at this hotel. There is direct access to the beach and the water looked like the pictures. do not be fooled by the beach chairs tho. They are NOT the hotels. The boardwalk is next door with LOTS of shops and eating places you can walk to. Souvenirs are a little cheaper at Alvins world. Overall we had a great time here.

Great family vacation spot. I loved the beach view. Lived that there were plenty of pools to swim in the grotto bar with waterfalls was fun for kids. Beach access was great. Loved that you had games throughout the whole property to play with. Mother polside movies every evening and kids activities were enjoyable and kids loved it. I liked that it was within walking distance to boardwalk and pier. The first night we got placed in a room that was not updated and it was on the outside facing an ally way it felt like a cheap motel and was not pleasant. We upgraded the next am to beach view balcony and it was updated and totally worth it.

Got a room for three and room was updated clean and stylish. The bathroom although nice had no place to hang your bath. Clean and close to other shops and restaurants. Beds were soft and comfortable. Bathroom situation was not ideal as I stated above.

My husband and I spent our honeymoon there last month. The staff was so kind and helpful. I was surprised at the beautiful grounds and how well the upkeep and wonderful places for memories for picture taking. I would stay again and recommend to family and friends.

Grat. Bed was not the greatest but motel was in process of remodel I had assume our floor was soon to be remodeled coffee was so so But overall the hotel staff and entire experience was GREAT and the GREATEST part is being pet FRIENDLYWe sure hope to come back Thank You Jef.

We survived The Island NEVER AGAIN. thats about it. from the construction noises. hammering and cutting from 8 am to 6 pm everyday to walking up and down the stairwells because both elevators were out of order. to the dogs barking all night and NO its NOT recently renovated. its in the middle of being renovated and having to ask for a microwave which a guy brought us a mini one. The 10 off the room was nt worth all the inconvenience or agrivation. The front desk people offer up ALOT of. I m Sorys NEVER AGAIN. WE SURVIVED 3 DAYS AT THE ISLAND. MAYBE THEY SHOULD HAND OUT T SHIRTS FOR AN AWARD.
